author: phil.eth
content: cant sync: `initial-sync: Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing required=1 suitable=0`

author: prestonvanloon
content: anything interesting at the debug level?

author: nishant0
content: you have `--no-discovery` as a flag ðŸ™‚

author: prestonvanloon
content: oh that will do it lol

author: nishant0
content: You wont be able to find any peers with that flag

author: phil.eth
content: okay, then it probably does something different than the lighthouse flag...

author: phil.eth
content: how to connect to exactly 1 node?

author: prestonvanloon
content: `--no-discovery` disables all discovery, it would only peer with peers that you specify specifically

author: prestonvanloon
content: use `--peer` flag

author: prestonvanloon
content: to define 1 node

author: nishant0
content: yeah ^

author: prestonvanloon
content:
`--no-discovery --peer=<peer address>`

<@!476250636548308992> is it multiaddress or ENR?

author: nishant0
content: both is fine

author: prestonvanloon
content: ok cool so put the ENR there or the libp2p multiaddr if you have it

author: phil.eth
content: thanks ðŸ™‚

content: works now

content: great!
